titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rose Marie Sinnott photograph collection V1987.002
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T14:34-0500

physdesc.extent: in one folder and two oversize boxes.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Rose Marie Sinnott photograph collection, V1987.002, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the photographs have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Rose Marie Sinnott, date unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Rose Marie Sinnott photograph collection consists of 16 black-and-white photographic prints dating from 1925 to 1968. The collection includes 15 oversized photographs depicting members of various social clubs and organizations attending large formal banquets held in Brooklyn. There is also one mounted photograph of the Brooklyn Doctor's Symphony Orchestra in performance, circa 1960. The photograph was printed at Ansalone's Photo Studio which was located at 1877 86th Street in Brooklyn. It is not known how (or if) the photographs are connected or why the collection was assembled.
